Package com.github.actionfx.core.view

Interface View

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBindingView, AbstractValidatingView, AbstractView, FxmlView, ParentView
    public interface View
    Interface for ActionFX views. It provides common routines to show or hide a view, or to lookup nodes within the scene graph.
    Author:
    koster

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        java.lang.String getId()
        The view ID, unique over all views.
        Returns:
        the view ID

      • getRootNode

        <T> T getRootNode()
        Returns the root node of the view. The returned type is generic, because not all nodes of the scene graph do inherit from Node - e.g. tabs of type Tab inside a TabPane. However, in most of the cases, FXML views are based on view components based on type Node.
        Returns:
        the root node of the view

      • show

        void show​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Shows the view in the supplied Stage.
        Parameters:
        stage - the stage to show the view inside

      • show

        void show​(javafx.stage.Popup popup,
          javafx.stage.Window owner)
        Shows the view in the supplied Popup.
        Parameters:
        popup - the popup to show the view inside
        owner - the window owning the popup

      • show

        void show()
        Shows the view in a new stage / new window.

      • showAndWait

        void showAndWait()
        Shows the view and waits in a modal fashion.

      • attachViewToParent

        void attachViewToParent​(javafx.scene.Parent parent,
                        NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher attacher)
        Attaches this view as child to the supplied parent, using the given NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher. This method can be used to compose a larger view out of multiple smaller views. An alternative use case could be to implement a "docking" functionality, together with method detachView() as the "undocking" operation.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent to attach this view to
        attacher - the NodeWrapper.NodeAttacher that defines the strategy, how to attach the view to a node

      • detachView

        void detachView()
        Detaches this view from the view node's parent.

      • reattachView

        void reattachView()
        Reattaches the a previously detached view again. In order for this operation to work, the view needs to have been initally attached via attachViewToParent(Parent, NodeAttacher).

      • hide

        void hide()
        Hides the view. This only works, when the view has its own stage.

      • getWindow

        javafx.stage.Window getWindow()
        Gets the Window where this view is currently displayed in. In case the view has not yet been displayed, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the Window in that this view is displayed, or null, in case the view has not yet been displayed.

      • getScene

        javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
        Gets the Scene that this view is part of. In case the view has not yet been added to a scene, null is returned.
        Returns:
        the Scene that this view is part of, or null, in case the view has not been added to a scene.

      • getController

        java.lang.Object getController()
        Gets the controller instance that handles actions from this view.
        Returns:
        the controller instance

      • getResourceBundle

        java.util.ResourceBundle getResourceBundle()
        Gets the resource bundle associated with this view.
        Returns:
        the resource bundle

      • lookupNode

        NodeWrapper lookupNode​(java.lang.String nodeId)
        Looks up a node that carries the supplied nodeId.
        Parameters:
        nodeId - the node ID
        Returns:
        the retrieved node, or null, in case there is no node with the given nodeId

      • getViewNodesAsStream

        java.util.stream.Stream<NodeWrapper> getViewNodesAsStream()
        Returns a stream to all nodes that participate in this view, starting from the root note (seegetRootNode()). The order of nodes in the stream corresponds to a depth-first search approach.
        Returns:
        the nodes of this view as a stream

      • bind

        void bind​(java.lang.Object model,
          BindingTargetResolver resolver)
        Performs a data binding between the supplied model and the controls that are part of this view.
        Parameters:
        model - the model to bind (can be a Java domain object with or without JavaFX properties)
        implementation - of BindingTargetResolver that resolves a field from the model to a control in this view.

      • unbind

        void unbind​(java.lang.Object model)
        Removes any binding between this view and a model object (usually bound via bind(Object, BindingTargetResolver)).
        Parameters:
        model - the model to unbind

      • unbindAll

        void unbindAll()
        Removes all bindings that have been established via former calls to bind(Object, BindingTargetResolver).

      • validate

        ValidationResult validate​(boolean applyValidationDecoration)
        Performs validations by applying validators added by calling #registerValidator(Control, Validator).

        Validation is guaranteed to be executed within the JavaFX application thread.

        Parameters:
        applyValidationDecoration - true, if validation decorations shall be applied to controls, false otherwise. In case no validation decorations shall be applied, it is up to the developer how to signal validation failures to the user of the UI.
        Returns:
        the result of the validation, including potential validation messages. If the validation was successful the result of ValidationResult.getStatus() will be ValidationStatus.OK.

      • validate

        default ValidationResult validate()
        Performs validations by applying validators added by calling #registerValidator(Control, Validator).

        Validation is guaranteed to be executed within the JavaFX application thread.

        Returns:
        the result of the validation, including potential validation messages. If the validation was successful the result of ValidationResult.getStatus() will be ValidationStatus.OK.

      • registerValidator

        void registerValidator​(javafx.scene.control.Control control,
                       ControlProperties controlProperty,
                       Validator validator,
                       ValidationOptions options)
        Adds a validator to the specified control.
        Parameters:
        control - the control to validate
        controlProperty - the property of the given control whose value shall be validated
        validator - the validator to apply to the control
        options - defines several options, how the validator shall be applied to the given control (e.g. the validation mode of the given control e.g. ValidationMode.ONCHANGE, when the value of the control is changed, or ValidationMode.MANUAL, if the validation has to be manually triggered via validate())

      • registerValidator

        void registerValidator​(java.lang.String nodeId,
                       ControlProperties controlProperty,
                       Validator validator,
                       ValidationOptions options)
        Adds a validator to the control that will be looked up for the given nodeId.
        Parameters:
        nodeId - the nodeId that shall be resolved to a Control.
        controlProperty - the property of the given control whose value shall be validated
        validator - the validator to apply to the control
        options - defines several options, how the validator shall be applied to the given control (e.g. the validation mode of the given control e.g. ValidationMode.ONCHANGE, when the value of the control is changed, or ValidationMode.MANUAL, if the validation has to be manually triggered via validate())

      • validationResultProperty

        javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<ValidationResult> validationResultProperty()
